creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: brown lacquer with a high scrolling central splat decorated with gold lacquer
text: These lacquered armchairs with distinctive scrolled-crest back splat, slender construction, and gilt decoration reflect the fashion of the Chien-lung period (1736-1795) toward increasingly elaborate forms. Fashioned from thin members, the chairs exhibit the light angular fretwork typical of middle Ch'ing taste. The splats display stylized dragon medallions and bamboo leaves executed in gold lacquer on a reddish-brown ground. At least five similar chairs are known in western collections.
title: Chair, One of a Pair
